Name: Mountainous
Description: Regions characterized by high elevation, steep slopes, and rugged terrain.

Name: Coastal
Description: Areas adjacent to oceans, seas, or large lakes, often featuring beaches, cliffs, or estuaries.

Name: Desert
Description: Arid regions with little rainfall, sparse vegetation, and extreme temperature variations.

Name: Urban
Description: Densely populated areas dominated by buildings, roads, and human-made infrastructure.

Name: Forest
Description: Land covered primarily with trees and undergrowth, supporting diverse wildlife.

Name: Grassland
Description: Expansive regions dominated by grasses with few trees, often used for agriculture or grazing.

Name: Wetland
Description: Ecosystems where water covers the soil, such as swamps, marshes, and bogs.

Name: Tundra
Description: Cold, treeless landscapes with permafrost, found in polar regions or high altitudes.

Name: Savanna
Description: Tropical grasslands with scattered trees, found in warm climates with distinct wet and dry seasons.

Name: Volcanic
Description: Regions shaped by volcanic activity, featuring lava fields, craters, and geothermal features.

Name: Polar
Description: Ice-covered landscapes found in Arctic and Antarctic regions, with extreme cold conditions.

Name: Steppe
Description: Semi-arid grasslands with moderate rainfall, often found between deserts and forested areas.

Name: Plateau
Description: Elevated flatlands with steep edges, formed by tectonic activity or erosion.

Name: Delta
Description: Low-lying land formed by river sediment deposition at the mouth of a river.

Name: Cave
Description: Underground formations created by geological processes, often found in limestone regions.

Name: Glacier
Description: Large masses of ice that move slowly over land, shaping the terrain through erosion.

Name: Mangrove
Description: Coastal ecosystems dominated by salt-tolerant trees, found in tropical and subtropical regions.

Name: Coral Reef
Description: Marine ecosystems built by coral organisms, supporting a diverse range of sea life.

Name: Fjord
Description: Deep, narrow sea inlets carved by glaciers, commonly found in cold coastal regions.

Name: Canyon
Description: Deep valleys with steep sides, often carved by river erosion over millions of years.

Name: Oasis
Description: Fertile area in a desert, where water allows vegetation to thrive.

Name: Badlands
Description: Eroded rock formations with steep ridges and minimal vegetation, found in arid regions.

Name: Sinkhole
Description: A natural depression caused by the collapse of underground cavities, often in limestone regions.

Name: Salt Flat
Description: Extensive, flat areas of land covered with salt deposits, formed by evaporated water bodies.

Name: Prairie
Description: Large, open grasslands with fertile soil, commonly found in temperate regions.

Name: Geyser Basin
Description: Regions with geothermal activity, where hot springs and geysers frequently erupt.

Name: Rainforest
Description: Densely forested areas with high rainfall and biodiversity, found in tropical and subtropical zones.

Name: Sand Dunes
Description: Hills of sand formed by wind, commonly found in deserts and coastal regions.

Name: Karst
Description: Limestone landscapes with caves, sinkholes, and underground rivers formed by water erosion.

Name: Chaparral
Description: Regions with dense, drought-resistant shrubs and hot, dry summers, often prone to wildfires.

Name: Lake
Description: Large inland bodies of water, either freshwater or saline, surrounded by land.

Name: River
Description: Flowing bodies of freshwater that move from higher elevations to lower areas, often emptying into larger water bodies.

Name: Sea
Description: Large saltwater bodies partially enclosed by land, often connected to oceans.

Name: Ocean
Description: Vast, continuous saltwater bodies covering most of Earth s surface.

Name: N/A
Description: N/A
